definition.doc: This is the most general application definition for multidimensional photoelectron spectroscopy.

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays

sym.name: doc
sym.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays

sym.name: nfa
sym.doc: Number of fast axes (acquired simutaneously) e.g. emission angle, kinetic energy

sym.name: nsa
sym.doc: Number of slow axes (acquired scanning a physical quantity) e.g. lens voltage, photon energy or temperature

sym.name: nx
sym.doc: Number of points in the first angular direction

sym.name: ne
sym.doc: Number of points in the energy dispersion direction

attribute.name: entry
attribute.doc: NeXus convention is to use "entry1", "entry2", for analysis software to locate each entry.

field.name: title
field.doc: Title describing the entry.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO8601 formatted date time of the start of the measurement.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms.

field.name: type
field.doc: Type of source. Any of these values: - Synchrotron X-ray Source - Rotating Anode X-ray - Fixed Tube X-ray - UV Laser - Free-Electron Laser - Optical Laser - UV Plasma Source - Metal Jet X-ray

field.name: name
field.doc: Free text name of the source.

field.name: probe
field.doc: Type of probe. In photoemission it's always photons, any of these values: - x-ray - ultraviolet - visible light

group.doc: Properties of the beam at the sample.

field.name: distance
field.doc: Distance of the point of evaluation of the beam from the sample.

field.name: incident_energy
field.doc: Incident photon energy.

field.name: incident_energy_spread
field.doc: FWHM energy linewidth of the incident photons.

field.name: incident_polarization
field.doc: Incident polarization specified as a Stokes vector.

field.name: description
field.doc: Free text description of the type of detector.

field.name: energy_resolution
field.doc: Energy resolution of the analyser with the current setting.

field.name: fast_axes
field.doc: List of the axes that are acquired symultaneously by the detector.

field.name: slow_axes
field.doc: List of the axes that are acquired by scanning a physical parameter, listed in order of decreasing speed.

field.name: scheme
field.doc: Scheme of the electron collection column.

field.name: mode
field.doc: Labelling of the lens setting in use.

field.name: projection
field.doc: The space projected in the angularly dispersive directions, i.e. real or reciprocal.

field.name: scheme
field.doc: Energy dispersion scheme employed.

field.name: pass_energy
field.doc: energy of the electrons on the mean path of the analyser.

field.name: energy_scan_mode
field.doc: Way of scanning the energy axis (fixed or sweep).

group.doc: Aperture generating the momentum and/or energy filtering.

field.name: description
field.doc: Type of aperture inserted in the beam. One of the following: - slit - pinhole - iris

field.name: shape
field.doc: Description of the shape of the active part of the aperture, curved or straight for horizontal slits, square or round for pinhole etc.

field.name: size
field.doc: The relevant dimension for the aperture (slit width, pinhole diameter etc).

field.name: amplifier_type
field.doc: Type of electron amplifier.

field.name: detector_type
field.doc: Description of the detector type.

field.name: raw
field.doc: Raw data before calibration.

field.name: calculated_energy
field.doc: Calibrated energy axis

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has an energy calibration been applied?

field.name: name
field.doc: Simple and descriptive name of the sample.

field.name: chemical_formula
field.doc: Chemical formula of the sample.

field.name: sample_history
field.doc: Ideally, a reference to the location or a unique identifier or other metadata file. In the case that is not available, free-text description.

field.name: preparation_date
field.doc: ISO 8601 date of preparation of the sample for the ARPES experiment (i.e. cleaving, last annealing).

field.name: description
field.doc: Free-text surface preparation technique for the ARPES experiment, i.e. UHV cleaving, in-situ growth, sputtering/annealing etc.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Temperature of the sample.

field.name: pressure
field.doc: Residual gas pressure at the sample.

field.name: data
field.doc: Processed plottable data.
